abstract: Apple brought back Steve Jobs about a decade after firing him. It could be time for H.P.’s own Jobsian moment by naming Walter Hewlett as chairman.
snippet: Apple brought back Steve Jobs about a decade after firing him. It could be time for H.P.’s own Jobsian moment by naming Walter Hewlett as chairman.
lead_paragraph: Oracle’s boss, Lawrence Ellison, may have unwittingly given Hewlett-Packard some brilliant advice. Before snatching Mark V. Hurd to help run his software company this week, Mr. Ellison called the board’s parting ways with the H.P. chief executive “the worst personnel decision since the idiots on the Apple board fired Steve Jobs.”

headline.main: H.P. Should Take a Page From Apple
headline.print_headline: Strategy for H.P., Courtesy of Apple

byline.original: By Rob Cox and Neil Collins
